days.overview: Jesus commissions His disciples to make disciples of all nations, baptizing and teaching them to observe all His commands. He promises His presence always.
days.reflection: What is the Great Commission? How are you making disciples? What does Jesus' presence with you mean?
days.prayer: Ask God to make you a disciple-maker and help you obey the Great Commission.

days.overview: Jesus promises His disciples will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes and be His witnesses in Jerusalem, Judea, Samaria, and to the end of the earth.
days.reflection: Where is your Jerusalem? How does the Spirit empower witness? How far does your witness reach?
days.prayer: Ask the Spirit to empower you to witness both locally and to the ends of the earth.

days.overview: The early church devoted themselves to teaching, fellowship, breaking bread, and prayer. They shared possessions, worshiped together, enjoyed favor with people, and the Lord added to their number daily.
days.reflection: How do these elements characterize your church? What does devotion to apostles' teaching mean? How does community life reflect the gospel?
days.prayer: Pray for your church to embody these characteristics and grow as the early church did.

days.overview: Christ gave apostles, prophets, evangelists, shepherds, and teachers to equip the saints for ministry, building up the body until all reach unity, maturity, and the fullness of Christ.
days.reflection: What is the purpose of church leaders? How are you being equipped for ministry? What does maturity in Christ look like?
days.prayer: Thank God for leaders who equip you and pray for growth toward maturity in Christ.

days.overview: Paul compares the church to a body with many members. All are necessary; none can say they don't belong or aren't needed. If one suffers, all suffer; if one is honored, all rejoice.
days.reflection: What is your role in the body? How do you value others' roles? How do you share in others' joys and sufferings?
days.prayer: Thank God for your place in the body and pray for unity and mutual care.

days.overview: Peter declares believers are a chosen race, royal priesthood, holy nation, God's possession, called to proclaim His excellencies. Once not a people, now God's people.
days.reflection: What does being a royal priesthood mean? How do you proclaim God's excellencies? What difference does being God's people make?
days.prayer: Thank God for making you His possession and help you proclaim His greatness.

days.overview: John sees a great multitude from every nation, tribe, people, and language standing before the throne worshiping God and the Lamb. This is the church's destiny.
days.reflection: How does this vision inspire the church's mission? What does worshiping with all nations mean? How does this hope motivate you?
days.prayer: Thank God for the promise that people from every nation will worship Him forever.
